intro: Thalictrodes biternata, commonly known as the three-parted false mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes mallows and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
